label: Model United Nations
description: Model United Nations (MUN) is the simulation of the UN's debate and decision-making process. We aim to solve a wide range of real-world problems and global issues, from marine biodiversity in the Red Sea to the Russo-Ukrainian War. In MUN, we participate as a delegate of a country to propose solutions and debate, a chair to provide background information and monitor debate processes, or an organiser to run an entire conference.
achievement: Since Year 6, I have participated in five conferences as a delegate, four conferences as a chair, and hosted one conference as the Secretary-General. I have won an honourable mention, an Outstanding Delegate, and a Best Delegate award. As the club leader, I have organised three travelling trips outside Beijing and sent delegates to 11 conferences around China in total.

label: NAE-UNICEF Summit
description: During this Summit, over 100 NAE students presented projects that our schools have taken to advance the United Nationâ€™s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in our communities this year. We cultivated our social purpose, tackled major issues using creative solutions, developed our leadership and advocacy skills, and connected with NAE students from across the globe. We participated in workshops led by UNICEF and World's Largest Lesson.
achievement: I represented BSB Shunyi as the student ambassador at this Summit. At the end of the Summit, there was a conference to share our solutions to an issue concerning one of the SDGs. Our group aimed to tackle SDG 10 Reduced Inequalities, particularly on education for the disabled population.

label: Seeway Tanzania
description: Seeway Tanzania is a non-governmental organisation which is committed to providing community development projects in Tanzania. In this project, we not only fundraised for Seeway Tanzania, but also travelled to Tanzania in February 2024.
achievement: Our team raised over $7000 for the organisation through charity sales, sporting events, and the school cafe since June 2023. During the trip, we assisted in the construction of the Dolly Bush Primary School, built goatsheds and donated a goat each to two families, and interacted with the local people.
